node.title: Should Americans 'Upgrade' Face Coverings to Surgical Masks Amid Omicron Spread?
node.description: Some health experts recommend switching to surgical masks amid the little-known information about Omicron and its transmissibility.

node.title: Rural contractor recommends hiring young people to build workforce
node.description: Chapman Agriculture owner Allan Chapman says the labour shortage has forced him to look closer to home.

node.title: US reports first Omicron case
node.description: The United States has identified its first known case of the new Covid-19 variant Omicron, discovered in a fully vaccinated patient who traveled to South Africa.

node.title: Wool price making a comeback as overseas demand for products rises
node.description: Higher demand for sportswear, rugs and other wool products has resulted in a resurgence in wool prices.

node.title: Iron World Appears to Be Lightest Exoplanet Ever Detected
node.description: Astronomers call it a “super-Mercury” and think it holds clues to how planets form close in to their stars.

node.title: A Guide to New York Holiday Events: Trains, Nutcrackers and a 79-Foot Tree
node.description: A rundown of seasonal celebrations in every borough, including the return of the Rockettes, miniature trains in the Bronx and light shows in Brooklyn.

node.title: Sister of Condemned Man in Saudi Arabia Asks F1 Star Lewis Hamilton to Help Free Brother
node.description: The sister of a man on death row in Saudi Arabia for unwittingly being a drug mule asked Lewis Hamilton to speak about him at his upcoming F1 race.

node.title: Two Men Charged With Murder of Teen Shot 18 Times Waiting for Bus, Police to Arrest 3 More
node.description: Both men allegedly involved in the 14-year-old's death are at least 20 years old and police consider the case "solved."

node.title: Rep. Jim Jordan Faces Backlash After Tweet Stating 'Real America Is Done With COVID-19'
node.description: The Ohio Republican's message on Twitter was met with a large response, especially from critics.

node.title: Anti-Abortion Activists Arrested After Spending Hours Inside Clinic For 'Intervention'
node.description: At least one woman left the White Plains, New York clinic "in tears," according to the group Red Rose Rescue, which claimed responsibility for the incident.

node.title: U.S. Military Records Thousands of Missing Military-Grade Weapons, Including TNT, Rockets
node.description: The Associated Press has released a new report discussing the large amounts of explosives missing from the U.S. military.

node.title: SA has opened it borders to COVID, what can Tasmania learn from it?
node.description: South Australia is a little over a week into reopening their borders and what happens with COVID-19 infections — and the death rate — is being watched closely by Tasmania, where the island state is soon to open up to the world.

node.title: People in NSW have to vote tomorrow — this is what you need to know
node.description: Almost every NSW resident has to vote in one of the more than 120 elections set to be held tomorrow. This is what you need to know.

node.title: Eye-opening moments in the classroom remind me why teaching is my dream job
node.description: I want to change negative perspectives and misconceptions about disability that I have faced my whole life. And already I've had so many special, eye-opening moments in the classroom that remind me I'm on the right path, writes Ashleigh Gibson.

node.title: If solar is now so cheap, why is my power bill still so high?
node.description: After years of increases, power prices are set to fall, thanks largely to cheap solar. So how cheap can solar get? And what does this mean for your electricity bill?

node.title: Satellites discover a huge cloud of undisclosed methane emissions over Australia, experts claim
node.description: Methane is a powerful, invisible gas that might be a key driver of global warming. Now satellite imagery is raising questions over whether Australia has been accurately reporting its emissions to international bodies.

node.title: Fears About the Future of Abortion
node.description: Readers express concern about the ramifications if Roe v. Wade is overturned. Also: Unvaccinated health workers; working remotely; hopes for Democrats.

node.title: The Cold Is Coming. Will New Yorkers Still Eat Outdoors?
node.description: Frigid weather, a new coronavirus variant and indoor service will put outdoor dining to the test this winter.

node.title: What does ‘grooming’ mean in sexual abuse cases?
node.description: The word, in the sense of surreptitiously preparing a target for abuse, is at the center of the sex-trafficking and conspiracy charges against Ghislaine Maxwell.

node.title: Los Angeles County Buries Over 1700 Unclaimed Dead in Mass Grave
node.description: The Los Angeles County streamed the ceremony to honor the 1,780 unclaimed who died in 2018 as they were placed in a mass grave Wednesday.

node.title: Landlord Reveals Horrific Feces-Smeared Apartment Left by Evicted Tenant
node.description: The Oregon landlord asked TikTok viewers whether his former tenant should be given back her deposit.

node.title: 'Excited and nervous': Auckland hospo reopens in traffic light system
node.description: Auckland cafes, bars and restaurants are reopening for table service under the new Covid-19 traffic light system, after months of lockdown.

node.title: Three new Covid-19 cases reported in New Plymouth
node.description: Health officials in Taranaki have revealed there are three cases of Covid-19 in New Plymouth.

node.title: Dad-daughter team gives RVs to people who lost homes in wildfires
node.description: For the last three years, Woody Faircloth and his 9-year-old daughter Luna have been taking special trips from Colorado to deliver RVs to families who've lost homes in California's wildfires.

node.title: What to Do With Cauliflower
node.description: … That isn’t cauliflower rice.

node.title: The Year’s Best Wine Books
node.description: These volumes, all from 2021, take you around the world and back, journeys that help to illuminate the people behind the bottles.

node.title: With No Resources, Authority or Country, Afghan Ambassador Presses On
node.description: Adela Raz arrived in Washington just before her country fell and has struggled to keep her embassy going. A dinner with U.S. veterans was a priority.

node.title: Norway Reports 50 Omicron Cases in Capital, Most Traced Back to Company Christmas Party
node.description: The outbreak comes in spite of party attendees having "high vaccination coverage," the Norweigan Institute of Public Health said Thursday.

node.title: U.S. Pump Prices Unlikely to Ease as Oil-Supplying Nations Approve Modest Supply Increase
node.description: OPEC and its allies took part in a meeting Thursday where they decided to approve a production increase of 400,000 barrels per day for the month of January.

node.title: 70 Venezuelans Apprehended by CBP as Number Arriving at Border Rises Amid Country's Turmoil
node.description: The group of undocumented migrants was encountered in Big Bend National Park, which sits on a portion of the border in West Texas.
